meanings.def: used to say that it is possible for somebody/something to do something, or for something to happen
examples: I can run fast.
Can you call back tomorrow?
He couldn't answer the question.
The stadium can be emptied in four minutes.
I can't promise anything, but I'll do what I can.
Please let us know if you cannot attend the meeting.

meanings.def: used to say that somebody knows how to do something
examples: She can speak Spanish.
Can he cook?
I could drive a car before I left school.

meanings.def: used with the verbs ‘feel’, ‘hear’, ‘see’, ‘smell’, ‘taste’
examples: She could feel a lump in her breast.
I can hear music.
Can you play the piano?
I can hear someone calling.
The podcast can be downloaded here.
Can you/​are you able to come on Saturday?
You’ll be able to get a taxi outside the station.
I haven’t been able to get much work done today.
She’d love to be able to play the piano.
Our daughter could walk when she was nine months old.
I was able to/​managed to find some useful books in the library.
I could find some useful books in the library.
We weren’t able to/​didn’t manage to/​couldn’t get there in time.
I could see there was something wrong.
I could have won the game but decided to let her win.

meanings.def: used to show that somebody is allowed to do something
examples: You can take the car, if you want.
We can't wear jeans at work.

meanings.def: used to ask permission to do something
examples: Can I read your newspaper?
Can I take you home?
Can I borrow your calculator?
You can come with us if you want to.
You can’t park your car there.
May I borrow your newspaper?
You may come if you wish.
Visitors may use the swimming pool between 7 a.m. and 7 p.m.
Students may not use the college car park.

meanings.def: used to ask somebody to help you
examples: Can you help me with this box?
Can you feed the cat, please?

meanings.def: used to make suggestions
examples: We can eat in a restaurant, if you like.
I can take the car if necessary.

meanings.def: used in the negative for saying that you are sure something is not true
examples: That can't be Mary—she's in New York.
He can't have slept through all that noise.

meanings.def: used to express doubt or surprise
examples: What can they be doing?
Can he be serious?
Where can she have put it?

meanings.def: used to say what somebody/something is often like
examples: He can be very tactless sometimes.
It can be quite cold here in winter.

meanings.def: used to say that somebody must do something, usually when you are angry
examples: You can shut up or get out!
He can speak three languages.
She will try and visit tomorrow.
You must find a job.
You ought to stop smoking.
I used to smoke but I gave up two years ago.
Can I invite Mary?
Should I have invited Mary?

meanings.def: as happy, etc. as possible
used to say that you do not like something and are unwilling to accept it
examples: I can't be doing with people who complain all the time.
I can’t be doing with you moaning all the time.

meanings.def: used to say that you are not able or willing to do something
examples: Sorry, no can do. I just don't have the time.

idioms.idiom: as happy, simple, sweet, etc. as can be
can’t be doing with somebody/something | can't be doing with somebody doing something
idioms.def: used to say that you do not like something and are unwilling to accept it
examples: I can't be doing with people who complain all the time.
I can’t be doing with you moaning all the time.

idioms.def: used to say that you are not able or willing to do something
examples: Sorry, no can do. I just don't have the time.

meanings.def: a metal container in which food and drink is sold
examples: can of something a can of beans/beer/soda
a beer can
He opened the can and took a large swig.
an aluminium/tin can
She sipped from a can of Coke.
The floor was littered with empty food cans.
This special type of milk comes in a can.
We opened a can of sardines for lunch.
a 200 g can of tuna

meanings.def: the amount contained in a can
examples: can of something We drank a can of Coke each.
Have you eaten the whole can?

meanings.def: a metal or plastic container for holding or carrying liquids
examples: an oil can
He filled a can with water from the pump.

meanings.def: a metal container in which liquids are kept under pressure and let out in a fine spray when you press a button on the top
examples: a can of hairspray

meanings.def: prison
the toilet
to be completed and ready for use
if you open up a can of worms, you start doing something that will cause a lot of problems and be very difficult
to accept the blame for something, especially when it is not your fault
to delay dealing with a problem
examples: This is another attempt to kick the can down the road and leave it to the next generation.

idioms.def: to be completed and ready for use
if you open up a can of worms, you start doing something that will cause a lot of problems and be very difficult
to accept the blame for something, especially when it is not your fault
to delay dealing with a problem
examples: This is another attempt to kick the can down the road and leave it to the next generation.

meanings.def: to preserve food by putting it in a can
to dismiss somebody from their job
examples: Upon learning he was sick, the company canned him without explanation.
